Isaiah or Isaias__57.1: The just perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart, and men of mercy are taken away, because there is none that understandeth; for the just man is taken away from before the face of evil.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.2: Let peace come, let him rest in his bed that hath walked in his uprightness.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.3: But draw near hither, you sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer, and of the harlot.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.4: Upon whom have you jested? upon whom have you opened your mouth wide, and put out your tongue? are not you wicked children, a false seed,
Isaiah or Isaias__57.5: Who seek your comfort in idols under every green tree, sacrificing children in the torrents, under the high rocks?
Isaiah or Isaias__57.6: In the parts of the torrent is thy portion, this is thy lot: and thou hast poured out libations to them, thou hast offered sacrifice. Shall I not be angry at these things?
Isaiah or Isaias__57.7: Upon a high and lofty mountain thou hast laid thy bed, and hast gone up thither to offer victims.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.8: And behind the door, and behind the post thou hast set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself near me, and hast received an adulterer: thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made a covenant with them: thou hast loved their bed with open hand.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.9: And thou hast adorned thyself for the king with ointment, and hast multiplied thy perfumes. Thou hast sent thy messengers far off, and wast debased even to hell.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.10: Thou hast been wearied in the multitude of thy ways: yet thou saidst not: I will rest: thou hast found life of thy hand, therefore thou hast not asked.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.11: For whom hast thou been solicitous and afraid, that thou hast lied, and hast not been mindful of me, nor thought on me in thy heart? for I am silent, and as one that seeth not, and thou hast forgotten me.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.12: I will declare thy justice, and thy works shall not profit thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.13: When thou shalt cry, let thy companies deliver thee, but the wind shall carry them all off, a breeze shall take them away, but he that putteth his trust in me, shall inherit the land, and shall possess my holy mount.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.14: And I will say: Make a way: give free passage, turn out of the path, take away the stumblingblocks out of the way of my people.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.15: For thus saith the High and the Eminent that inhabiteth eternity: and his name is Holy, who dwelleth in the high and holy place, and with a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.16: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be angry unto the end: because the spirit shall go forth from my face, and breathings I will make.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.17: For the iniquity of his covetousness I was angry, and I struck him: I hid my face from thee, and was angry: and he went away wandering in his own heart.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.18: I saw his ways, and I healed him, and brought him back, and restored comforts to him, and to them that mourn for him.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.19: I created the fruit of the lips, peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, said the Lord, and I healed him.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.20: But the wicked are like the raging sea, which cannot rest, and the waves thereof cast up dirt and mire.
Isaiah or Isaias__57.21: There is no peace to the wicked, saith the Lord God.
